brief.brief: The Event Name/Number fields used to define when events will occur.
Note: The OnFocusIn, OnFocusOut, and OnNewValue fields mean that an event will trigger any time an action occurs on the associated form. This could affect system performance.

detail.detail: OnFocusIn: Each time an object (combo box, radio button, and so on) receives focus, Service Manager sends this event. You can use the OnFocusIn field with the cursor.field function, for example, to trigger an event when a field receives focus.
OnFocusOut: When focus leaves an object (combo box, radio button, and so on), Service Manager sends this event.

OnFormModified: When a user modifies any field in a record, Service Manager knows that a record is being updated. For example, you can use this definition to place a lock on a record once the form is modified.
OnNewValue: If a value in a specified field changes, then this event will trigger.
